...Oh. Out already.

Of course I cleaned up the competition! Now, let's get to fixing this place up!
As EXPECTED! None of you SIMPLE FLESHLINGS stood a CHANCE, Mew!~

Tsk. That was easy!

{narrate}* Lesser Dog may have lost the game, but he won the hearts of those above.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog has reached new heights and doesn't mind that he lost this game of poker.
{narrate}* The game may be over, but Lesser Dog will probably be here for a while...
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is enjoying some premium fresh air.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is in a better place now.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog doesn't know how it got here.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is happy that the kibble on the top shelf is finally within his reach.

{narrate}* You try to call out to Lesser Dog, but it is too late.
* He cannot hear you.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is whining because he can't see anyone.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is overjoyed at the amount of sticks he can see.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is barking at a very long cat in the distance.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is up in the clouds, doing the exact same thing he always does.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog can see his dog house from here.
{narrate}* You must be this tall to pet the dog.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog sees Papyrus, Woshua, and the others hanging out off screen.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is barking excitedly in the distance.

{narrate}* Lesser Dog has become a home to a few birds.
* A dog house.
{narrate}* You want the innuendos to go over Lesser Dog's head, but it's a tall order.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is putting a remarkable, yet un-seeable, amount of effort into keeping his balance.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is thinking about chasing the sun.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is thirsty. He starts licking the clouds.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog hears someone open a bag of Popato Chisps from far away. He looks towards the horizon longingly.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog bumped into some angels and is now receiving heavenly chin scritches.
{narrate}* It's probably for the best that Lesser Dog can't see any of this.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog's head really should have started coming down by now...
{narrate}* Lesser Dog wonders how many times this is going to happen in his life.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is thinking about gravity for the first in his life.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog has escaped the confines of the Character Editor. He's looking at all of your unfinished projects.

{narrate}* Lesser Dog did not consider bringing oxygen on this journey.
* He's used to being unprepared.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog wonders if it's normal to see bright flashes of light at this altitude.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog hasn't been this light headed since college.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog struggles to stay out of the way of Tsunderplane's family.

{narrate}* Lesser Dog's head breaks through the ceiling!
* It's unclear how that's possible out here.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog Appears.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is getting excited with so many new friends around!
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is excited to have so many new friends to play with!

{narrate}* Lesser Dog is barking excitedly.
* His excitement knows no bounds.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog raises his head, hoping you'll give him head pats.

{narrate}* Lesser Dog is being a good boy.
* He is also overstimulated.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog shows no signs of stopping.
{narrate}* There is no way to stop this madness.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is out of control.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog's head breaks through the ceiling!
{narrate}* Lesser Dog can smell the restaurant at the end of the universe.

{narrate}* Lesser Dog has spotted life on Mars.
* ...It looks pretty unremarkable, to tell the truth.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog wishes he hadn't slept through his orbital mechanics briefing.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog discovers the Moon does NOT taste like cheese.
{narrate}* You could probably use Lesser Dog as a space elevator, now.

{narrate}* Lesser Dog still can't see the end of the rainbow.
* He wants his money back.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is beginning to forget what having a normal sized neck was like.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is approaching enlightenment.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog makes first contact with an incredibly long-necked alien.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog discovers a creature with massive feathered wings and floating rings full of eyes.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog's view of his home is beginning to redshift.
{narrate}* It is unclear how Lesser Dog is still standing here.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog doesn't remember what galaxy he came from.
{narrate}* Space historians will be exploring Lesser Dog's neck for millenia, searching for its origin.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is beyond this game of poker at this point.
{narrate}* One may never see as much as Lesser Dog has now had the pleasure to observe.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is beyond the edges of the observable universe.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog really hopes he's been a good dog.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog wants to make everyone proud.
{narrate}* There are only so many ways to convey how long this dog's neck is.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is beginning to realize he may never see his toys again.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog hasn't paid his taxes yet, but it's unlikely the IRS will ever find him now.
{narrate}* Lesser Dog is chasing mailmen of other dimensions.
